title: Paralympic champion Marieke Vervoort dies by euthanasia
text:
Belgian Paralympian Marieke Vervoort, the T52 100m champion from the 2012 London Games has died by euthanasia at the age of 40, Belgian media reported on Tuesday.

Euthanasia is legal in Belgium and the para-athlete announced her intentions after the Rio Games in 2016 to follow that path if her degenerative condition worsened her suffering.

Despite falling sick aged 14 Vervoort pursued a sporting life with passion, playing wheelchair basketball, swimming and racing in triathlons.

In 2017 she gave an exclusive, in depth interview to the Daily Telegraph- one of her last of such length - talking about her struggles with pain.

“I don’t want to suffer any more,” she said. “It’s too hard for me now. I get more and more depressed. I never had these feelings before. I cry a lot," she said.

“Everybody sees me joyful, winning medals, being strong, but they don’t see the other side. That is why every Paralympian is, to me, a champion.”

She talked of struggling to sleep, sometimes getting only 10 minutes a night. “I can’t sleep at night. My psychologist knows it. I want her to be with me when I die. She works at the hospital but even she says: ‘It is a lot that you are going through. I have never seen anything like this.’”

Vervoort also had epileptic seizures and had one in 2014 when she was cooking pasta and spilled boiling water over her legs. That resulted in a four-month hospital stay.

A loyal Labrador named Zenn began staying with her, pawing her when a seizure was about to occur. Zenn also pulled her socks out of the sock drawer, she said, and helped carry groceries home when Vervoort bought too much.

“Everything I drop on the ground, she picks it up and gives it to me,” Vervoort said of the dog. “When I lose consciousness, she barks and the nurses come, and she stays licking my face until I come back around. She pulls out my socks, my jacket, opens and closes doors. She will stay with me forever. I could not even imagine giving her away.”

Speaking of her planned death in 2017, Vervoort said: “The people will cry, but I want them also to give thanks for the life I had, for the fact that I’m happy now I’m at peace.”
description: Belgian Paralympian Marieke Vervoort, the T52 100m champion from the 2012 London Games has died by euthanasia at the age of 40, Belgian media reported on Tuesday.
